metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5009 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The handle_command function in mon/Monitor.cc in Ceph allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and ceph monitor crash) via an (1) empty or (2) crafted prefix.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-base - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-common - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-fuse - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-mds - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-mon - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-osd - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-resource-agents - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
ceph-test - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
libcephfs-java - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
libcephfs-jni - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
libcephfs2 - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
librados2 - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
libradosstriper1 - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
librbd1 - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
librgw2 - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python-ceph - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python-cephfs - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python-rados - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python-rbd - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python-rgw - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph-argparse - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python3-cephfs - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python3-rados - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python3-rbd - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
python3-rgw - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
radosgw - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
rbd-fuse - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
rbd-mirror - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
rbd-nbd - 12.2.0-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ceph package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.2.0-0ubuntu1').
